name: Erskine Hewitt
biography: Erskine Hewitt began his career as a lawyer and later focused on real estate development. A graduate of Princeton University, he amassed a large collection of early Americana, Revolutionary War relics, and related decorative arts objects—many of which he donated to the Cooper Union Museum, founded by his sisters Sarah and Eleanor.
biography_75_words: Erskine Hewitt began his career as a lawyer and later focused on real estate development. A graduate of Princeton University, he amassed a large collection of early Americana, Revolutionary War relics, and related decorative arts objects—many of which he donated to the Cooper Union Museum, founded by his sisters Sarah and Eleanor.
biography_50_characters: Lawyer, philanthropist, and collector of Americana
